isis.stitle: VT 275 Engine Service Manual - Cylinder Head and Valve Train - Installation - Cylinder Head Torque Instructions and Tightening Sequence

svcproc.title: Cylinder Head Torque Instructions and Tightening Sequence

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, use only permanent type ink markers, do not use any type of paint or other temporary marking to identify head bolt torque orientation.
To prevent engine damage, check to make sure all push rods has been seated in their respective rocker arm pivot recesses.

To prevent engine damage, all head bolts (M14 x 192) must be replaced when installing cylinder head. Lubricate new bolt threads, flanges and mating surfaces with a light coat of clean engine oil. Too much oil will cause hydrostatic lock and give an incorrect torque reading.

To prevent engine damage, do not use anti-seize compounds, grease, or any other lubricant other than engine oil on the cylinder head bolt threads. Other lubricants have an adverse effect on torque results.

step1.para: Lightly lubricate new cylinder head bolts (M14 x 192) with clean engine oil. Install eight bolts in the open positions finger tight.
Remove the two rocker arm carrier alignment guides and replace with two remaining newly oiled bolts finger tight.

figure.caption: Torque sequence for cylinder head mounting bolts

step1.para: Torque all bolts numbered 1 through 8 in sequence to 88 N·m (65 lbf·ft).
Torque bolts 1, 3, 5, and 7 in sequence to 116 N·m (85 lbf·ft).
Torque bolts 2, 4, 6, and 8 in sequence to 116 N·m (85 lbf·ft).
Torque all bolts numbered 1 through 8 in sequence clockwise 90 degrees.
Torque all bolts numbered 1 through 8 in sequence a second time clockwise 90 degrees.
Torque all bolts numbered 1 through 8 in sequence a third time clockwise 90 degrees.
M14 x 192 bolt torque sequence is complete.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, lubricate smaller bolt threads (M8 x 70), flanges and mating surfaces with a light coat of clean engine oil. Too much oil will cause hydrostatic lock and give incorrect torque reading.

step1.para: Torque all bolts numbered 9 through 12 in sequence to 24 N·m (18 lbf·ft).
Torque all bolts numbered 9 through 12 in sequence to 31 N·m (23 lbf·ft).
M8 x 70 bolt torque sequence is complete.
